articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Protesting students in Bangladesh have called for a march to the capital Dhaka on Monday in defiance of a nationwide curfew to press Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to resign, a day after deadly clashes in the South Asian country killed nearly 100 people.
articles.title: Bangladesh protest: Students call for march to force PM to quit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Several U.S. personnel were injured in an attack against a military base in Iraq on Monday, three U.S. officials told Reuters, as concerns in the region mounted following last week's killing of senior members of militant groups Hamas and Hezbollah.
articles.title: Exclusive: US personnel wounded in attack against base in Iraq, officials say

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is facing mounting frustration within Israel and abroad over his handling of faltering talks aimed at securing a Gaza hostage release and ceasefire deal, according to three Israeli officials.
articles.title: Frustration with Netanyahu mounts as Gaza talks falter

articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris is expected to announce her running mate by Tuesday after conducting interviews with top contenders at her Washington, D.C., residence over the weekend, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.
articles.title: Kamala Harris to announce vice president pick before battleground states tour

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: Israel returned the bodies of more than 80 Palestinians killed in its military offensive in the Gaza Strip, as Israeli airstrikes killed at least 18 more people on Monday, the Palestinian Ministry of Health said.
articles.title: Israel returns 80 Palestinian bodies to Gaza, keeps up military pressure

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will hold an emergency meeting with police chiefs on Monday after days of violent anti-immigration protests intensified, with buildings and vehicles torched and hotels holding asylum seekers targeted.
articles.title: UK's Starmer to hold emergency meeting as riots intensify

articles.author: John Kruzel
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday rejected a bid by the state of Missouri to halt Donald Trump's upcoming sentencing for his conviction in New York on felony charges involving hush money paid to a porn star and left a related gag order until after the Nov. 5 presidential election.
articles.title: US Supreme Court declines to halt Trump's sentencing in hush money case

articles.author: Vivian Sequera, Mircely Guanipa
articles.description: Venezuelan security forces are targeting those who they say committed violent crimes during recent protests over the disputed election, in an operation informally called "knock-knock" that advocacy groups say has left protesters fearful.
articles.title: Maduro security forces round up Venezuelans involved in protests in 'operation knock-knock'

articles.author: David Brunnstrom
articles.description: Nine staff members of the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestinian Refugees (UNWRA) may have been involved in the Oct. 7, 2023, Hamas attack on Israel, and have been fired, the United Nations said on Monday.
articles.title: Nine UNRWA staff members were possibly involved in attack on Israel, UN says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least four Palestinians were killed and seven others injured by Israeli fire in the town of Aqaba, Tubas District, in the occupied West Bank early on Tuesday, according to the Palestinian health ministry. Two of the injured were in critical condition.
articles.title: At least 4 Palestinians killed in Israeli raid in West Bank, health ministry says
